# Troty Energy research facility Wiki

## Notice: I'm going to be entirely redoing this page soon, so try not to make any major edits to it sk -stud

Welcome to the Troty Energy Research Facility!

T.E.R.F is a fictional research facility refurbished inside an old research facility inside a volcano for the purpose of studying fusion technology.

## Wiki Notice - August 17 2025

If you see missing or incorrect images, download them from [the old wiki](https://terf.fandom.com) and upload them on their respective pages.

The linked page contains basic information about the S.T.F.R.

More advanced info about the S.T.F.R is located in [TERF Logistics](https://terf.fandom.com/wiki/Category:TERF_Logistics).

title: Hadron_Collider
content: The Hadron Collider is a machine in the TERF Facility, used to smash items into other items at high speeds to create new items. It is a major part of the Netherite Refining Process. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the Interface Cauldron facing forwards Power Input: Into the Interface as seen in tutorial video Power Consumption(MW): ${ { Length\times 16}}$. Build Tutorial: The Hadron Collider Interface is used to insert and extract items from the Hadron Collider. * Since the locations of other components depend on the location of the interface, it should be placed first (or planned for) and the location doesn't matter, as long as you have enough space for the rings. * The interface has many lightning rods sticking in towards the center, but only 1 facing out. Use this lightning rod to connect the interface to the Hadron Collider Terminal. * No, you cannot build multiple interfaces on a single collider like with the IRL Large Hadron Collider. That would be cheating. Additionally, a layer-by-layer build tutorial can be found here (https://imgur.com/a/gEIYTw8). Aside from the Hadron Collider Interface, the Hadron Collider also needs these copper rings to function * The rings need to be a one block big continuous (also referred to as \" wide\") tunnel between the two sides of the interface, made out of either copper coils or tinted glass. * The tunnel can go up or down, it doesn't have to stay on one layer. * The Hadron Collider requires at least 128 rings. Additional rings can be used to speed up recipe processing. To operate the Hadron collider, you need a Hadron Collider Terminal. * The terminal can be built anywhere, though it is recommended that you place it close by to your Hadron Collider Interface, so you can turn it on and off while also depositing items. * The Hadron Collider Terminal, unlike the STFR and DEM terminals, does not require a multiblock core or a mainframe connection. * To connect the terminal to the Hadron Collider, use a Data Connection to connect it to the collider interface. Recipes: Please note that the location of inserted items matters | Left Input | Right Input | Base Length | Result | |------------|-------------|-------------|--------| | 1× Slime Block | 6× Coal | 75 Base Length | 2× Diamond | | 2× Diamond | 16× Redstone | 80 Base Length | 1× Netherite Scrap | | 2× Iron Ingot | 24× Iron Nugget | 40 Base Length | 24× Gold Nugget | | 8× Iron Nugget | 8× Gold Nugget | 80 Base Length | 4× Glowstone Dust | | 4× Iron Ingot | 4× Gold Ingot | 28 Base Length | 8× Copper Ingot | | 1× Copper Ingot | 24× Stone | 69 Base Length | 4× Iron Ingot | | 8× Netherite Ingot | 64× Glass | 120 Base Length | 1× Nether Star | | 8× Gold Nugget | 8× Iron Nugget | 5 Base Length | 8× Redstone Dust | | 4× Charcoal | 4× Charcoal | 50 Base Length | 7× Coal | | 1× Slimeball | 2× Netherite Dust | 100 Base Length | 1× Ender Pearl | | Left Input | Right Input | Base Length | Result | Special Property | |------------|-------------|-------------|--------|------------------| | 1× Nether Star | 7× Netherite Scrap | 100 Base Length | 1× Netherite Upgrade Template | This recipe will be removed | | 1× Red Bed | 4× Ancient Debris | 100 Base Length | Placed Bedrock | This causes the hadron to create a temporary gravitational anomaly which sucks in surrounding blocks |

title: Wet_Mill
content: The Wet Mill is a machine used to pulverize fine crushed materials into very fine dust. Multiblock Core Placement: Into the pot; Power Input: In the Conductor Block; Power Consumption: 6MW during operation. Fluid Extraction: Fluids are extracted below the decorated pot via copper pipes; Cauldrons must be full of water. Recipes: Items are inserted into the input hopper. | Input | Output | Gold Dust | Gold Slurry | More recipes | Soon | Composed by SonyXM4

title: Electrolyzer
content: The Electrolyzer is an electrical molecule debonder used to convert water into oxygen and hydrogen. Chemical reaction: H2O -> 2H + O. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Please refer to build tutorial; Power Input: Conductor Block on the machine; Power Consumption: Unknown. Build Tutorial: https://imgur.com/gallery/electrolyzer-build-tutorial-LAmKmya (multiblock core block highlighted in green for clarity). Recipe: Water 30mb -> Hydrogen 20mb + Oxygen 10mb (processing time: 100 ticks).

title: Large_Fluid_Solidifier
content: The Large Fluid Solidifier is a lapis-catalyzed mass liquid freezer used for converting liquids into blocks. Technical Information: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the Lapis Block, facing towards the output conveyor belt; Power Input: Not needed; Power Consumption: None; Activation: Provide the machine with the correct amount of input liquid. Recipes: Water (2,000 mB) -> Ice; Mineral Magma (2,000 mB) -> Coal Ore (~34.5%), Copper Ore (~32.7%), Redstone Ore (~13.5%), Gold Ore (~9.70%), Iron Ore (~3.25%), Diamond Ore (~2.99%), Lapis Ore (~2.91%), Ancient Debris (0.3%). Located at the topside of TERF.

title: Netherite_Refining_Process
content:
# Netherite Refining Process

## Summary

The Netherite Refining Process is a step-by-step recipe for making netherite out of automatable resources using TERF.

This process is what makes the creation of a Warp Core in survival possible.

## Ingredients

The initial ingredients required to create netherite are listed below.

| Resource         | Amount Per Netherite Ingot | Amount Per Netherite Block | Amount Per Warp Core (32 Netherite Blocks) | Automation Method                              |
|------------------|---------------------------|---------------------------|--------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------|
| Honeycomb        | 9                         | 81                        | 2592                                       | Created in the TERF Facility's Biodome.        |
| Coal/Charcoal    | 12/~14                    | 108/~124                  | 3456/~3950                                 | Created by the Large Fluid Solidifier or Smelted from Logs. |
| Redstone         | 16                        | 144                       | 4608                                       | Created by the Large Fluid Solidifier. |

You will also need access to the following machines:

## The Recipe

Listed below are the steps which are part of the recipe.

### Step 1

* Input: Honeycomb (9 per Ingot, 81 per Block, 2592 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Crafting Table
* Output: Honeycomb Block (~3 per Ingot, ~21 per Block, 648 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 4 Honeycomb -> 1 Honeycomb Block
* Notes: Technically, you can also skip this step and do the next step with regular honeycomb, but this process is quite quick and speeds up the following step by a factor of 4.

### Step 2

* Input: Honeycomb Block (~3 per Ingot, ~21 per Block, 648 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Electric Press
* Output: Slime Ball (9 per Ingot, 81 per Block, 2592 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 1 Honeycomb Block -> 4 Slime Ball

### Step 3

* Input: Slime Ball (9 per Ingot, 81 per Block, 2592 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Crafting Table
* Output: Slime Block (1 per Ingot, 9 per Block, 288 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 9 Slime Ball -> 1 Slime Block

### Step 4

* Input: Charcoal (~14 per Ingot, ~124 per Block, ~3950 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Hadron Collider
* Output: Coal (12 per Ingot, 108 per Block, 3456 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 4 Charcoal + 4 Charcoal -> 7 Coal
* Notes: Optional, you can also feed the following steps with just coal.

### Step 5

* Inputs: Slime Block, (1 per Ingot, 9 per Block, 288 per Warp Core) Coal (12 per Ingot, 108 per Block, 3456 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Hadron Collider
* Output: Diamond (2 per Ingot, 18 per Block, 576 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 1 Slime Block + 12 Coal -> 2 Diamond

### Step 6

* Inputs: Diamond, (2 per Ingot, 18 per Block, 576 per Warp Core) Redstone (16 per Ingot, 144 per Block, 4608 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Hadron Collider
* Output: Netherite Scrap (1 per Ingot, 9 per Block, 288 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 2 Diamond + 16 Redstone -> 1 Netherite Scrap

### Step 7

* Input: Netherite Scrap (1 per Ingot, 9 per Block, 288 per Warp Core)
* Machine: Open Core
* Output: Netherite Ingot (1 per Ingot, 9 per Block, 288 per Warp Core)
* Recipe: 8 Netherite Scrap -> 8 Netherite Ingot
* Notes: This step is used only for efficiency and speed, you can also just use the normal gold recipe if you don't have an open core. You, however, would have to quadruple the rest of the recipe.

title: The_S.T.F.R
content: The S.T.F.R is a fusion reactor located in the Troty Energy Research Facility Structure: The S.T.F.R. consists of 6 stabilisers, an encasing superstructure and the main core Core: * This is the core of fusion reaction, where the main processes happen * This core is only present inside the superstructure when the reactor is in operation * The core consists of a shield layer and internal deuterium-deuterium based fusion core * The shield layer consists of one regenerative primary shield, one regenerative internal shield and three non-regenerative shields Case: * The encasing superstructure is a sphere-like structure around the core of the reactor * As the core generates heat during operation, the heat is transferred to the case, where coolant is boiled into steam and directed to steam turbines to generate power Stabilisers: * The stabilisers play a crucial role in keeping the core in a stable state and preserving the integrity of core shields Crucial Components Breakers - The breakers supply the S.T.F.R. with DC current - They are only needed during startup or restabilisation - AC current is input at the bottom conductor; DC is output from the top conductor Coolant Pump * This pump pumps the coolant for the S.T.F.R. Control Panel * Used to operate the S.T.F.R. Mainframe - This is the main computer that connects most machines - Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal - Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network Turbine and generator * Upon heating up the reactor case, steam is produced and can be directed into turbines to generate power * Turbines have to be connected with steam pipes to the S.T.F.R. * Turbines have to be connected with coolant pipes to the S.T.F.R. Composed by SonyXM4

title: The_D.E.M
content: The D.E.M. is a black hole based full mass to energy conversion device that uses black holes to convert matter into GigaWatts or even TeraWatts of power. # A massive warning that the info in the dem page is incorrect because it literally spreads misinformation ### Structure add a gallery when you get evenly square versions of the individual compopnents of the D.E.M. Component List of images to add * Proper Square Full Render * Core * Horizon Scrubber * Power Laser * Power Extractors * Stabilizer * Startup Manifold (Only if its easy to get) #### Core * This is the black hole core of the D.E.M. where hawking radiation for power generation comes from * This is only present while the D.E.M. is in operations, or as a ball of compressed matter during startup, which then gets compressed by gravitational amplification * The core is kept stable using a gravity shield that prevents the gravity of the black hole from extending past intended boundaries * The core is generally being orbited by the accretion disc, which is the disc of matter falling into the core to generate power, this disc can stall if complete desaturation is allowed, but the accretion disc can simply be reformed #### Horizon Scrubber * Prevents the atmosphere inside the room from reaching into the accretion disc, which would uncontrollably saturate the disc, potentially destabilizing the gravity shield by throwing core parameters out of control * It does not prevent anything from falling into it, allowing the accretion disc to be resaturated during operations using any form of matter #### Power Lasers * Stabilizes one part of the D.E.M.'s Operation, wether it'd be the accretion disc's rotational energy or thermal energy, or causing EMR flux in the core or feeding it some mass #### Power Extractors * Extracts power from the core using the emitted hawking radiation, due to how accelerated the hawking radiation decay process is, this generates a lot of power #### Stabilizers * Stabilizes the gravitational shield, preventing the black hole from tearing the facility and the planet apart #### Startup Manifold * Generates the accretion disc ### Operation Parameters #### Global Laser Offset - Offsets the lasers from the singularity of the core, eventually changing their modes across 4 different overall modes 0. Extremely Low Offset: Feeds the singularity directly, slightly increasing core mass 1. Low Offset: Enters the EMRIRS Without hitting the singularity, causing superradiant scattering within the EMRIRS and eventually exiting back out as EMR Flux 2. Medium Offset: Low leverage on the accretion disc, warming it up more than it adds rotational energy to it 3. High Offset: High leverage on the accretion disc, adding rotational energy more than it warms it up #### Global Power Laser - Acts as a general multiplier to the effect of the current laser offset's mode #### EMRIR Shield Density - Increases EMR Flux * This would increase the accretion disc temperature based on how high this gets * This would decrease the gravity shield's stress based on how high this gets #### Horizon Scrubber Engage Percentage * Decreases Accretion Disc Saturation * This decreases core spin due to having less matter to fall into the core * This is also based on how fast the disc is spinning * THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT DO ANYTHING #### Field Compression Control - Increases hawking radiation by reducing core mass * This increases power generation - THIS IS CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED AND DOES NOT ANYTHING #### Electron Injection - Increases Reactor Charge * This causes higher disc de-saturation * This causes lightning bolt strike if get too high ( 9000-12000 ) ## Crucial Components Missing: Proper & Square D.E.M. Control Panel Image ### Control Panel * Used to operate the D.E.M. ### Mainframe * This is the main computer that connects most machines * Can be used to find out player IDs for Security Terminal * Used to connect and disconnect machines from the whole network Full name: 'Superradiant Scattering Type Full Mass Conversion Electromagnetic Radiation Internally Reflecting Shield Dark Energy Manipulator Reactor' (SSTFMCEMRIRSDEMR).

title: Physical_Connections
content: Machines require physical connections: electrical, fluidic, or digital. Omnidirectional Connecting Blocks (input/output any side), Directed Connecting Blocks (input/output opposite sides). Types: Electrical Cables (power), Hot Fluid Pipe (steam, mineral magma), Cold Fluid Pipe (coolant), Data Connection (control panels and multiblocks via mainframe).

title: Arc_Furnace
content: The Arc Furnace is an electrothermal processing unit used to remelt whole blocks into different or more pure materials. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Into the copper block as shown in building tutorial; Power Input: On top of the coil; Power Consumption: 16MW during operation. Build Tutorial: https://imgur.com/a/FT7tKqH. Recipes: Cobblestone -> Magma Block, Stone -> Magma Block, Magma Block -> Lava, Wet Sponge -> Sponge, Sand -> Glass, T.N.T. -> Diamond Block™, Sculk Catalyst -> Budding Amethyst, Sculk -> Cobweb, Smooth Stone -> Deepslate, Cobbled Deepslate -> Gravel, Calcite -> Quartz Block, Polished Deepslate -> Basalt, Blackstone -> Tuff, Raw Copper Block -> Copper Block, Raw Gold Block -> Gold Block, Raw Iron Block -> Iron Block. To smelt blocks, place them inside the furnace.

title: Electric_Press
content: The Electric Press is a mechanical press used to press various items into other items. Technicals: Multiblock Core Placement: Shown in infobox image (highlighted in red); Power Input: Above top cut copper block; Power Consumption: 1500 MWt every operation; Activation: Each operation is activated by powering the piston. Recipes: 1x Honeycomb -> 1x Slimeball, 1x Honeycomb Block -> 4x Slimeball, 8x String -> 1x Leather, 5x Blaze Powder -> 1x Blaze Rod, 1x Netherite Scrap -> 1x Ancient Debris.

title: OpenCore
content: Furnace using two positron emission units to remelt items 4x more efficiently. Multiblock Core Placement: Into iron blocks at bottom; Power Input: Into conductor blocks; Power Consumption: 1000mWh-10000mWh. Requires active M.C.F.R., C.R.R., S.T.F.R or D.E.M. Usage: temperature orders must be met; failure causes small/medium/large explosions depending on recipe complexity. Recipes: e.g., 8x Netherite Scrap -> 8x Netherite Ingot, 32x Glowstone Dust -> 24x Blaze Powder, 1x Netherite Block -> 1x Heavy Core.

title: C.R.R.
content: The Catalyzed Redstone Reactor (C.R.R.) is a matter conversion reactor that generates power by absorbing saturation from the core. It is the second reactor after the M.C.F.R., utilizing Helium-4 that it produces. Components: Catalyzer, Energy Collector, and Projector. Requires constant input of Redstone, Amethyst Blocks, and Ender Pearls. Startup: Input redstone, amethyst blocks, ender pearls, and 500 mB Helium-4 (5% chance of startup failure). Controls: Saturation Extraction Rate (extracts saturation), Catalyzer Injection (increases C. Catalyzer), ™B Projection (reduces Shield Stress by using F. Shield). Emergency Operations: Meltdown (Core Temperature increases Shield Stress, if >100% shield degrades), Stall (occurs when out of C. Redstone or 0% saturation), Startup Failure (5% chance, causes unstable shield formation). Logistics: No Core Temp limit but higher temp = more Shield Stress. Ender pearls increase F. Shield, Redstone increases C. Redstone, Amethyst Blocks increase F. Catalyzer. Inspired by Anti Mass Spectrometer from Half-Life and Dark Energy Construct from Garry's Mod.

title: Charging_Station
content: The Charging Station is an electromagnetic device charger used to charge items and tools. It provides a means to recharge various TERF equipment and devices.

title: Diesel_Generator
content: The Diesel Generator is a power-generating multiblock tri-piston diesel engine that provides passive power generation. It constantly generates 6MW while the multiblock structure is intact. Has no stats or controls. Main purpose: Keep facility operational while STFR and DEM are offline, as well as during their startup sequences. Can be used as alternative to STFR or DEM in smaller bases. There are 4 Diesel Generators placed back-to-back with oxidized copper block parts shared in the TERF facility.

title: Extended_Mainframe
content: Extended Mainframe is an unreleased addon which makes it easier to connect Mainframe servers. The addon allows server stacks to reach a maximum height of 5 blocks and allows singular servers to be connected via the sides and top. Glitches: While checks are in place to prevent connecting a server from the sides or top if the server is already connected from the bottom, it is possible to connect a single server 5 times by connecting it via every side and the top at the same time.

title: Fission_Reactor_Lambda_Core
content: The Lambda Core is a fission reactor used to transmute certain blocks into other blocks via neutron irradiation. Technicals: No power input/consumption or multiblock core required. Iron blocks: Absorbs neutrons. Coal blocks: Slows neutrons. Lapis blocks: Reflects neutrons. Control rods: Stops neutron emission when inserted into Fuel rods. Transmutation Recipes: Ancient Debris -> Diamond Block, Copper Block -> Coal Block, Gold Block -> Ancient Debris, Wheat Crop -> Nether Wart, Sandstone -> Soul Sand, Oak Sapling -> Pale Oak Sapling, Brown Mushroom Block -> Warped Fungus, Red Mushroom Block -> Crimson Fungus, Dried Ghasts -> Ghast Tear.

title: Gold_Slurry

title: M.C.F.R.
content: The Modular Catalyzed Fusion Reactor (M.C.F.R.) is the first reactor that players make in TERF. It is a regular fusion reactor that generates Heavy Steam and Helium-4 through hydrogen-water reactions. Structure: One M.C.F.R. slab consists of four M.C.F.R. Assemblies. Inputs: Power for preheating, hydrogen input, water input, steam output. Warning: Missing any inputs/outputs can cause over-pressure, ventilation damage, and fatal explosions (explosion size scales with hydrogen amount). Helium-4 can be routed to tank or smokestack but requires proper disposal to prevent suffocation. Startup Process: Need multimeter, fluid ID, and syringes. Add 20,000 mB water, start electrolyzer for hydrogen, connect power cable for preheating (remove when hearing noise), wait for temperature to rise and drop, use syringe to remove water and raise hydrogen temperature. Takes ~30 minutes to produce Helium-4. Recommended Values per slab: 20,000 mB Water, 8,000 mB Hydrogen, 860°C Hydrogen. Maximum Values per slab: 30,000 mB Water, 10,000 mB Hydrogen, 1000°C Hydrogen, 2,500 mB Helium-4. Inspired by HBM's NTM ZIRNOX reactor based on MIRNOX reactor.

title: S.T.F.R._Restabilization
content: Introduction: This page will explain all types of Critical Reactor Core states and their Restabilizations. All Critical Core states are caused by failing Shield Integrity. Overload: An Overload is usually caused by Reactor Core stats being out of safety parameters. Once a Reactor Overloads, all Core stats will run out of control as the Stabilizers are no longer able to contain the Core. The Case will start burning from the Heat and the Core will start to shoot beams of light. After a while the Case will explode and radioactive particles will start filling the room. It is advised not to touch these particles. If no action is taken during this time and the MSSR reaches 0, the Core can no longer be held back and will explode. How to prevent the core from exploding: 1. Start the manual restabilization sequence by replacing the redstone lambs in the Stabilizers with Amethysts, then pressing SSTB at the console. 2. Use the Stasis Laser by placing a Netherite block in it and then press the button on the Stasis laser. Manual Restabilization Sequence: With the Stabilizer lambs replaced by Amethyst you are now able to temporarily keep the core from exploding with an auxiliary shield. This shield lasts for 3 minutes before breaking. During this time several steps are needed in order to save your core (and your entire base). The list must be done in order: 1. Go to your mainframe and unlink the S.T.F.R. Controller from your S.T.F.R. 2. Go to your breakers and activate them (Don't forget to switch power grids if you are playing on the T.E.R.F. Map) 3. Go to your mainframe again and relink the Controller 4. Replace the Amethyst back to Redstone lambs 5. Press SSTB If all steps are completed within the 3 minute time window, well congratulations!, you can take a deep breath. However it's not over yet. The auxiliary shield must be compressed back to the regular reactor shield. For this the reactor will automatically initiate a Power Surge. During a Power Surge all controls are multiplied by 10x. That means you need to take extreme caution unless you want to end up with another Overload... If you can't complete all steps within the 3 minute time window, the reactor will resume its prior Overload state. You can no longer do a Manual restabilization Sequence and only the Stasis laser can save you now from certain doom. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-zHSilZ10vY Underload: An Underload is caused by the core getting colder than 8000°C. This will cause exponential shield stress. Once the Shield Integrity is at 0%, it will cause the Core to collapse in on itself and the Stabilizers will get stuck in place because they froze due to the extreme cold. Initially this is not a threat, but it will be in due time if the Core is not reignited! If no actions are taken the Core shield will blow off which causes an unstoppable explosion. Underload Restabilization: An Underload is easier to fix than an Overload. You will have to replace 5 of the now frozen Glowstone inside a Stabilizer with new Glowstone. If the Glowstone is replaced, press SSTB for a reignition power Surge. Once again keep in mind that the power surge multiplies your control inputs by 10x! Video coming soon:tm: Startup Failure Restabilization: A Startup Failure has a 2% chance to happen when starting up the Reactor. You will receive 6 minutes to restabilize the Core. Restabilization can only occur if 4 Stabilizers are connected to the Turbine power grid. The end of each Stabilizer will need a power cable attached to it. Do not disconnect the cooling line (Steam and water pipes) because that would halt the power production you desperately need. Stabilizer U and D currently do not have any connections they need and can be freely connected to. Your breaker input Stabilizer needs to be connected to and your mainframe connector input Stabilizer need to be connected. This also means your console will not work for the time being. Once all 4 Stabilizers are connected the reactor will automatically initiate a restabilization Power Surge. Do not forget to reconnect your Controller or you won't be able to control your reactor. Again, a Power Surge will make your controls multiply by 10x! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSJJZMk50MU Notes: - Shield Integrity will rapidly decrease if all stabilizers are broken while the Reactor is online. - During a Power Surge the Core will have 10x natural heating! title: S.T.F.R._Startup
content: S.T.F.R. Startup provides a step-by-step guide for starting up the S.T.F.R. (Work in Progress, written specifically for official map). Step by Step Guide: 1. Turn the key lever on (lever tip must face down), 2. Press the SSTB button, 3. Switch to Reactor grid (go to Main Facility Breakers room for correct configuration), 4. Activate Core Breakers (breaker buttons should change color to black and appear pushed in), 5. Press the SSTB button again (initiates reactor ignition and starts the core). Common Issues: Breakers do not work (can be caused by insufficient power directed to breakers - need at least 24 MW, or breaker output connection not connected to S.T.F.R.). Image references: https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:Breakers.png, https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:FacilityBreakers.png, https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:SSTBButton.png, https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:KeyLeverOn.png. Note: Refer to fan-made Quick start tutorial PDF for additional guidance.

title: S.T.F.R._Stabilization
content: S.T.F.R. Stabilization covers reactor operations, controls, and recommended values. S.T.F.R. Controls: Stone buttons control Stabilizer Offset (increases/decreases core spin), Stabilizer Input (decreases pressure movement from core to case), Power Lasers (increases core temperature), Pressure Vent (relieves case pressure), Fuel Injection (increases core pressure and temperature), Cooling Lasers (decreases core temperature). Status Panels: Shield Stress panel shows Spin Stress (increases exponentially beyond 150,000 RPM), Pressure Stress, Heat Stress, Cold Stress, Ratio Stress. Shield Status shows Shield Integrity and MSSR (Magnetic Shield Stress Reduction - increases by 1 unit per 5,000 RPM). Reactor Status, Fuel panel (Usage, Stored Locally: 69,420, Stored in Core), Waste panel (not implemented), Lubricant panel (prevents maintenance), Capacitor Charge and Reactor Uptime, Heat & Cooling panel (HTR, CR, CA), Generating panel (power generation estimation, MCi radiation). Emergency Controls: Automatic Case Shield Projection (ACSP), Emergency Fire Suppression System (EFSS - currently broken), Core Power Surge. Recommended Values: Core Spin 120k RPM, Core Temperature 90k°C, Core Pressure 200k kPa, Case Pressure 60k kPa, Case Temperature 500°C. Maximum Values: Core Spin 80,000-150,000 RPM, Core Temperature 15,000-110,000°C, Core Pressure 280,000 kPa, Case Pressure 80,000 kPa, Case Temperature 1,000°C. Image references: https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:STFREmergencyControls.png, https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:STFRStatusPanel.png, https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:STFRControlPanel.png.

title: Slangs
content: The Slangs of TERF community terminology: kis = kys but not really, sk = skull, y = yes, X = hard no, s = also skull (chia uses this), UwU = furry, :3 = cat, OH MY FKING GOD = omfg (anthony uses this). These are commonly used terms and expressions within the TERF community.

title: Wrench
content: The Wrench is a tool used for changing block rotation states and fixing maintenance. Usage: Maintenance - While the S.T.F.R. is online and there is no lubricant in the system, maintenance may occur requiring use of a wrench to fix it. Hold place block button (normally right click) and point cursor to source of particles, success indicated by hammering sounds and particle source moving. Block Rotation - Hold wrench and activate place block button (normally right click) to change rotation of items, affects stairs, trapdoors, and many other blocks. Fabrication: Requires power source and Fabricator. Recipe: Two iron nuggets, iron pressure plate, iron ingot, lightning rod, and red dye. Item placement locations shown in recipe image. Image references: https://trotyenergyresearchfaciliy.miraheze.org/wiki/File:WrenchRecipe.png (recipe), https://static.wikitide.net/trotyenergyresearchfaciliywiki/9/96/J6x9G0.png (main image).
